name: Bilateral Acute Retinal Necrosis (BARN)
chief_complaint: I've been seeing floaters and flashes of light in both eyes, and now my vision is getting blurry.
physical_findings: peripheral retinal necrosis with sharp borders
treatment: prophylactic laser retinopexy to prevent retinal detachment
prognosis: Guarded - high risk of retinal detachment and permanent vision loss despite treatment. Early intervention improves outcomes.
description: Bilateral Acute Retinal Necrosis is a rapidly progressive viral retinitis caused by herpesviruses (HSV-1, HSV-2, or VZV). It features full-thickness retinal necrosis beginning in the periphery and spreading circumferentially and posteriorly. The condition is vision-threatening and requires emergent treatment.
